unnormalised: New Delhi – Leading telecom operators Bharti Airtel and Reliance Jio announced revisions to their prepaid data plans this week, sparking heated debate among consumers and industry analysts. The changes, effective 15th August, largely involve a price increase of approximately Rs. 50-100 across various tiers, while some plans offer marginally increased data allowances.
normalised: New Delhi – Leading telecom operators Bharti Airtel and Reliance Jio announced revisions to their prepaid data plans this week, sparking heated debate among consumers and industry analysts. The changes, effective fifteenth August, largely involve a price increase of approximately rupee fifty to one hundred across various tiers, while some plans offer marginally increased data allowances.

unnormalised: Analysts at the Indian Institute of Telecom Management (IITM) are divided. Dr. Sharma from IITM stated, "The price hike reflects rising infrastructure costs, including 5G rollout expenses." However, consumer advocacy groups argue the move disproportionately affects low-income users, especially in rural areas where data connectivity is crucial for accessing government schemes and online education.

unnormalised: Reliance Jio, in a statement, highlighted its investment in expanding its 4G network across 2,500 sq ft of previously unconnected villages in the North-East. Concerns remain about the impact on digital inclusion across India.
